programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Emotions ran high in the days following the Nov. 11, 2001 attack on the U.S.; for the most part, the grief and anger brought people together but for Frank Roque, it was a motivation for killing an innocent immigrant chasing the American dream.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: It takes a lot of planning and skill to pull off an armored car heist in broad daylight outside a mall on one of the busiest shopping days of the year; Timothy Ring and his crew pulled it off, but never planned on how to get away with it.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Scott Falater claims he was sleepwalking when he brutally stabbed and drowned his wife and the mother of his children.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: At one point, Baby Gabriel's mother Elizabeth Johnson claimed she killed him; at another, she said that she gave him to a mysterious couple in Texas.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Retired pathologist Dr. Jack Kevorkian was charged for second-degree murder in the assisted suicide of 30-year-old Thomas Hyde.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: While the discovery of the victim's body in this case was considered a physician-assisted suicide, police investigators treated the scene as a homicide.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Thomas Hyde, who suffered from Lou Gehrig's disease, ended his own life by releasing a clamp that freed a flow of carbon monoxide to a face mask.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: A video tape of the defendant talking to Thomas Hyde and his fiancée was played in the courtroom; jurors watched Hyde's fiancée, Heidi Fernandez, talking to Dr. Jack Kevorkian about her husband's diagnosis and his slow deteriorating bodily illness.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The medical examiner, who performed the autopsy of the victim, testified to what happens to a body succumbing to ALS.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: A second Detroit police officer in a row testified for the state; Jack Kevorkian's white van was found in a city park and then later processed; the deceased body of Thomas Hyde was found in the back of that van.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Outside the presence of the jury the judge - the Honorable Thomas Jackson heard arguments on both sides on the legal issue of how to adjudicate a dead body that was possibly killed in one county.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The judge heard arguments by the state and the defense on the matter of jurisdiction of where exactly a crime was committed.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors went deep into the security system of the home where he was alleged to have kidnapped Jennifer Fulford, a nanny in the home.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Follow the money was the theme in the police's investigation into Jennifer Fulford's death.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The GPS system of Jennifer Fulford's SUV pointed police to where her abandoned car was. A cell phone examination showed her movements after she went missing.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors got more intricate details to the crime scene where the remains of Jennifer Fulford were found in a grassy, wooded area. This was just miles away from where she was abducted in the home she was working as a nanny.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The forensic pathologist who conducted the autopsy of Jennifer Fulford testified. Jurors learned the brutal fashion she lost her life by multiple stab wounds and suffocation.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State was completing the bus route of the Scott Nelson just hours after he allegedly kidnapped Jennifer Fulford. Two city bus operators confirmed to the jury that the defendant rode their buses on his way out of town.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Emotions run high during the testimony of Allison McCabe; she breaks down for jurors the harassment she said her family and friends faced over the allegations surrounding the death of John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Colin Albert answers questions under cross-examination; he testifies that he was at the Albert family home just hours before John O'Keefe appeared on the snowy front lawn; more than a half-dozen members of the Albert family testify in this trial.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Karen Read's defense keeps trying to raise reasonable doubt in the state's case against her over the death of her boyfriend; her lawyers keep going back to the Alberts, an influential family in the town of Canton, Mass.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: From the Albert Family to the McCabe Family
programme.desc: Colin Albert wraps up his extensive testimony in the killer or cover-up murder trial; the defense tries to suggest that he may have had something to do with John O'Keefe's death, which Albert denies.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors hear from a close friend of the Albert family; he happened to be at the bar hanging out with the defendant and her boyfriend, John O'Keefe just hours before he was found in the snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Recalling the Bar Scene to the House Party
programme.desc: Sharing more testimony about the hours before the death of John O'Keefe; Matthew McCabe is on the stand; his wife was the one who called 911 after the discovery of the victim in the snow.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Harry wanted to do the right thing when he agreed to talk to his brother's sometimes-girlfriend Kimberly Passwaters about their relationship; when Dave Beck killed her, the right thing became being the state's star witness in Dave's murder trial.
